item.title: Report E-2023080599
item.description:
Report E-2023080599

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 3, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel arrived and assessed the site. Crews observed the release to be towards the back of the trailer and pavement underneath. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the hydrogen peroxide-impacted surfaces and swept them in with hand tools. The hydrogen peroxide-impacted absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pail was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and all other cleanup debris was placed into another 55-gallon drum. All three (3) drums of waste were staged in the terminal's waste holding room

item.title: Report E-2023080509
item.description:
Report E-2023080509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: PORTSMOUTH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: APEX LOGISTICS INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESCRIPTION: A 40ft ocean container caught fire while in transit storage prior to loading at the CSX ramp in Norfolk, Virginia. The fire was caused by undeclared and improperly packaged Lithium Ion Batteries (EV Vehicle Batteries). The container was loaded at a facility in St Louis, Missouri, chosen by the shipper. However, the shipping documents provided by the shipper to Apex Logistics, declared the commodity as "Copper Flakes" and not dangerous goods. RESPONSE: Upon notification of the fire, Apex Logistics International LLC informed the steamship line CMA CGM that there could be undeclared dangerous goods in all the containers from this shipper. 24 containers from this shipper were in Norfolk, VA. INVESTIGATION: A surveyor has inspected the containers, and out of the 24 containers, all 24 of them have been identified to contain some form of dangerous goods, specifically batteries either class 9 or class 8. Some of the containers, contained D/D/R Lithium Batteries that were correctly packed according to the 49 CFR, however at least 4 containers contained unpacked Recycled Lithium Batteries (EV Batteries). CORRECTIVE ACTIONS: Due to the severity and complexity of the incident, the shipper, Zhiyun Sports LLC, has authorized Apex Logistics International LLC to arrange the pickup, storage, and return of the containers. Apex Logistics has contracted a hazardous materials emergency service (Hepaco) to assist in the offloading and safe storage of these dangerous goods.

item.title: Report E-2023080557
item.description:
Report E-2023080557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's above-ground storage tank. The gauging device on the storage tank was not working properly. This resulted in the storage tank being overfilled and approximately 60 gallons of diesel fuel being released. Sentinel Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

Report X-2023080534

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in main tower chute after accidently being sent up to conveyor belt. Package was removed after discovering container was leaking from the inside. DescribePack: Lid on container had appeared to loosen and cause leakage, resulting in damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Container was removed from area and placed in damaged hazmat container to prevent further spills on ground.

item.title: Report E-2023080333
item.description:
Report E-2023080333

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 27, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of UN1263 paint had a leak due to a defective component and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew transferred the virgin product into five (5) new 55-gallon drums. ES personnel then deployed granular absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1263-impacted product in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080314
item.description:
Report E-2023080314

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: STERLING
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver connected fittings and hoses. Started pot 4 then pot 3. When driver turned on pot 3 hose came off resulting in spill of around 10 gallons. Driver immediately shut valve off and grabbed absorbent pads. Used spill kit on trailer to prevent spill from entering storm drains and cleaned up area of parking lot where it occurred.
